'''Thorn Sir''' ("Eagle-stream") was a river according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''. It was located beneath [[Cirith Thoronath|Cristhorn]], at the bottom of a gorge in the [[Encircling Mountains]] into which [[Glorfindel]] and the [[Balrogs|balrog]] fell. After this battle the river was stained black by the balrog's blood for many days.<ref>{{LT2|III}}, pp. 192-4</ref> Its [[Qenya]] cognate was '''''Eäsindi'''''.<ref>{{PE|13}}, p. 105</ref>

This river was later mentioned as '''Thornsir''' in an unfinished [[fragment of an alliterative Lay of Eärendel|lay of Eärendel]],<ref name=LB>{{LB|2b}}, p. 142</ref> but was not used by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in any other text.
